description: [Status: stable] [Name: unintentional-type-annotation] [Message: Possible unintentional type annotation (using :). Did you mean to assign (using =)?] What it does Checks for the unintentional use of type annotations. Why is this bad? The use of a colon (:) in lieu of an assignment (=) can be syntactically valid, but is almost certainly a mistake when used in a subscript or attribute assignment. Example a["b"]: 1 Use instead: a["b"] = 1
